chemoreception.notes: Catfishes in general rely heavily on chemoreception for locating food and navigating their environment, likely applicable to Trichomycteridae.

mechanoreception.notes: Catfishes possess barbels and lateral line systems for detecting vibrations and water currents, important for orientation and prey detection. Likely applicable to Trichomycteridae.

vision.notes: Although some catfish families living in caves might have reduced vision, the information provided does not suggest that Trichomycteridae has generally lost this sense. Some members are used as food, suggesting functional vision.
